page.title: 11Education in Bassenthwaite
page.content: In Bassenthwaite village there was a Dame School which was in Willow Cottage. The present church room was originally the first parish school in Bassenthwaite,and in 1874 the average number of pupils was 44. That school closed on 18 Dec 1874, and everything was moved to Bassenthwaite Board School, just over a hundred metres away. It opened on 16 Jan 1875. Attendance was 75 children. Due to weather conditions the attendance sometimes fell by half. 1918 and 1919 the school was closed for 9 weeks because of an flu epidemic. In 1939 there were 97 pupils, 59 from Bassen_ thwaite and 38 evacuees. In 1941, snowstorms closed the school. In 1985 there are 20 children and 1.3 teachers . There is 1 big classroom and 1 small where the children work. There are toilets and a canteen across a yard.
